text: The men's triple jump competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 9 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was João Carlos de Oliveira of Brazil. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record |rowspan=2| |rowspan=2| 17.89 |rowspan=2| Mexico City, Mexico City |rowspan=2| October 15, 1975 |- |Pan American Games record |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |João Carlos de Oliveira | |17.27 | |- | |Willie Banks | |16.88 | |- | |James Butts | |16.69 | |- | |Alejandro Herrera | |16.46 | |- | |Carmelo Martínez | |16.28 | |- | |Francisco de Oliveira | |15.93 | |- | |Wilfredo Almonte | |15.69 | |- | |Ernesto Torres | |15.06 | |- | |José Mangual | |15.04 | |- |10 |Maxwell Peters | |13.97 | |- | |Stephen Hanna | | | |- | |Ronald Chambers | | | |- | |Edgar Moreno | | | |- | |José Salazar | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
